title: 112_hr3804
content:
The "American Opportunity and Freedom Act of 2012" includes provisions such as the permanent extension of income tax relief, repeal of estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes, repeal of the alternative minimum tax, repeal of tobacco product excise tax increase, and repeal of tax increases related to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The "American Opportunity and Freedom Act of 2012" includes provisions for the permanent extension of income tax relief by repealing sunset provisions from previous acts. SEC. 103. The Secretary of the Treasury must submit technical changes to the Internal Revenue Code within 90 days. TITLE II--PERMANENT REPEAL OF ESTATE AND GENERATION-SKIPPING TRANSFER TAXES. SEC. 201. Repeal of estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes. The chapter shall not apply to estates of decedents dying after December 31, 2010, except for certain distributions from Qualified Domestic Trusts. Generation-Skipping Transfer Tax Repeal is addressed in a new section. The chapter does not apply to generation-skipping transfers after December 31, 2010. Conforming amendments are made to the table of sections for subchapters C and G. Sec. 2664 states that certain provisions related to estate tax and carryover basis will not apply to estates of decedents dying after the enactment of the Act. Section 304 of the Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010 is repealed. The amendments made by this section apply to estates of decedents dying after December 31, 2010. SEC. 301 repeals the individual alternative minimum tax for taxable years starting after December 31, 2010. SEC. 401 repeals the tobacco product excise tax increase. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009. A floor stocks refund is provided for tobacco products and cigarette papers held for sale before the enactment of the Act. The Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009 amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a floor stocks refund for tobacco products and cigarette papers held for sale before the enactment of the Act. The amendments specify the time limits for filing claims and define terms used in the subsection. Controlled group rules apply, and the effective date is after the enactment of the Act. TITLE V--REPEAL OF TAX INCREASES RELATING TO PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT

SEC. 501. Repeal of revenue provisions related to PPACA, effective on enactment date. Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to be applied as if provisions had never been enacted.

SEC. 502. Repeal of tax provisions related to individual mandate, effective on enactment date. Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to be applied as if provisions had never been enacted. SEC. 503. Repeal of tax provisions relating to employer mandate. Effective upon enactment, certain sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act are repealed.
